DESCRIPTION.P: Let C- stands for the control key. The following keyboard commands are available:

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: C-a
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: moves the cursor to the beginning of command line.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: C-b
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: backspace, moves the cursor one character to the left

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: C-f
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: forwards, moves the cursor one character to the right

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: C-k
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: kills command line from cursor to the end.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: !beg
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: looks for last command line which begins by beg.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: C-c
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: interrupts Scilab and pause after carriage return. (Only functions can be interrupted). Clicking on the stop button enters a C-C.
